title: TreatWarningsAsErrors doesn't work for MSB3836
body:
<!-- This is a template that helps us provide quicker feedback. Please use any relevant sections and delete anything you don't need. -->

### Issue Description
TreatWarningsAsErrors doesn't work for MSB3836

### Steps to Reproduce
even when specifying 
`<TreatWarningsAsErrors>true</TreatWarningsAsErrors>`
the warning is not treated as error

`C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\MSBuild\Current\Bin\amd64\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(2424,5): warning MSB3836: The explicit binding redirect on "System.Net.Http, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a" conflicts with an autogenerated binding redirect. Consider removing it from the application configuration file or disabling autogenerated binding redirects. The build will replace it with: "<bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-4.2.0.0" newVersion="4.2.0.0" xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1" />". 
`

got to specify additionally:
`<WarningsAsErrors>MSB3836</WarningsAsErrors>`
after this the warning is treated as error

`C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\MSBuild\Current\Bin\amd64\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(2424,5): error MSB3836: The explicit binding redirect on "System.Net.Http, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a" conflicts with an autogenerated binding redirect. Consider removing it from the application configuration file or disabling autogenerated binding redirects. The build will replace it with: "<bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-4.2.0.0" newVersion="4.2.0.0" xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1" />". 
`
### Versions & Configurations
C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise>msbuild /version

nodes.body: Team Triage: This is expected, the properties to set to turn warnings into errors are `WarningsAsErrors` (like you found) and `MSBuildTreatWarningsAsErrors`.

Team Triage: It's not! 😬

cc @ghogen as we need to document this.
